title: Recommended Reads on the Mobile Beat This Week
text:
September 18, 2015 Recommended Reads on the Mobile Beat This Week A roundup of the most interesting stories about mobile technology from other sites, collected by Rachel Metz, MIT Technology Review’s senior editor for mobile. 
We’re on the Brink of a Revolution in Crazy-Smart Digital Assistants Wired looks at the progress that has been made in creating digital assistants that we can interact with by speaking naturally to smartphones and other electronics, what this will mean, and what still needs to be done to make this work. 
Smartphones Bring Happiness and Headaches to Myanmar NPR takes a look at how the proliferation of smartphones in Myanmar–from 500,000 five years ago to 22 million today–is changing a country where many residents were previously offline. 
Google Has Hired a Bunch of Engineers From Amazon’s Lab126 for a New Wearable Tech Initiative Called ‘Project Aura’ Business Insider reports that Google, widely believed to be working on a new version of its Glass head-worn computer that is more enterprise-geared, is creating it within a new group called Project Aura that will also work on other wearable projects.
